text:
Originally reported by: **Claudiu Popa (BitBucket: [PCManticore](http://bitbucket.org/PCManticore), GitHub: @PCManticore)**

---

This should be done only when Class.getattr is invoked and not from Instance.getattr (since attributes of the metaclass can only be accessed from the class, not the instance). 

---
- Bitbucket: https://bitbucket.org/logilab/astroid/issue/114
title: Make Class.getattr to look into Class.implicit_metaclass()
Make Class.getattr to look into Class.implicit_metaclass()

text:
_Original comment by_ **Claudiu Popa (BitBucket: [PCManticore](http://bitbucket.org/PCManticore), GitHub: @PCManticore)**:

---

Class.getattr looks by default in the implicit and the explicit metaclasses, which is `type` on Python 3.

Closes issue #114.
